questions.text:
#### Q1. How can you minimise all views except for the currently selected view in the Eclipse interface?

- %OPTION% Press Control-M (Windows) or Command-M (Mac)
- %OPTION% Double-click the tab you want to maximise
- %OPTION% all of these answers
- %OPTION% Click the Maximise button at the top right of the view

#### Q2. What happens when you execute the Run -> Skip all Breakpoints command?

- %OPTION% All breakpoints are deleted
- %OPTION% none of these answers
- %OPTION% All breakpoints will not be fired when debugging and will not cause application execution to suspend
- %OPTION% All breakpoints and bookmarks are disabled

#### Q3. What is not a key part of Eclipse projects and technologies?

- %OPTION% Plug-in Development Environment (PDE)
- %OPTION% Eclipse Project
- %OPTION% Java Development Toold (JDT)
- %OPTION% Eclipse .NET

#### Q4. Which is a valid way to create a code snippet?

- %OPTION% Right-click the selected code and select Add to Snippets
- %OPTION% Drag the code into the snippets view
- %OPTION% Click Source -> Snippets -> Create Snippet
- %OPTION% With the code selected, click the + button in the Snippets view

#### Q5. In this image, what does the circled button do?

- %OPTION% It expands the comparison between the two files to include whitespace.
- %OPTION% It allows you to delete the line of code to which it is connected.
- %OPTION% It allows changes from one version of a file to be applied to another version of the file.
- %OPTION% It allows you to merge both lines of code together.

#### Q6. When inserting a snippet containing variables into a source file, how are values for the variable defined?

- %OPTION% Eclipse fills them in with a drop-down menu of available optons.
- %OPTION% They are automatically highlighted in code.
- %OPTION% They are populated using environment variables.
- %OPTION% You populate them through a pop-up windows.

#### Q7. How can you create a new Git branch in Eclipse?

- %OPTION% all of these answers
- %OPTION% Right-click your project in the Package Explorer and select Team -> Switch To -> New Branch
- %OPTION% Click File -> New -> Git -> Branch
- %OPTION% Click Source -> Team -> Switch To -> New Branch

#### Q8. Why might you use the Open Type button?

- %OPTION% to open a file by its name
- %OPTION% to search the workbench for a class to open in an editor
- %OPTION% to find a string in a text file
- %OPTION% to find all places where a certain type is instantiated

#### Q9. In the JUnit view, what is the value in the parentheses after a previously run unit test?

- %OPTION% the number of errors found in the test
- %OPTION% the time it took the test to run
- %OPTION% the name of the package containing the test class
- %OPTION% the test class name

#### Q10. In this image, what does the circled icon in the Problems view do?

- %OPTION% It sends the currently selected problem to another view.
- %OPTION% It indents the currently selected problem.
- %OPTION% It opens the Filter menu so you can customise what problems are displayed.
- %OPTION% It jumps to the currently selected problem in the Editor.

#### Q11. What can you not do in the Expressions view?

- %OPTION% track the value of a variable throughout the lifetime of the app.
- %OPTION% change the name of a variable while debugging.
- %OPTION% change the value of a final variable while debugging.
- %OPTION% track values of variables when they are out of scope.

#### Q12. Your code is highlighted in red when running code coverage. Why is this?

- %OPTION% The code is the cause of a compiler warning.
- %OPTION% The method is unused or causes runtime errors.
- %OPTION% The code is within an if statement that is always evaluated as true at runtime.
- %OPTION% No code calls the method.

#### Q13. When selecting the Synchronise Workspace option for a project, what perspective is opened?

- %OPTION% Git
- %OPTION% Java
- %OPTION% Team Synchronising
- %OPTION% Remote Synchronise

#### Q14. Which is not a way to check the value of a variable while debugging?

- %OPTION% Hover ove the variable in the Editor.
- %OPTION% Check the Debug view.
- %OPTION% Check the Variables view.
- %OPTION% Watch the variable in the Expressions view.

#### Q15. How can you configure Eclipse to open a webpage in a browser outside of Eclipse using the Windows (Eclipse) -> Preferences -> General -> Web Browser dialog page?

- %OPTION% Select Use external web browser.
- %OPTION% Select Add a new browser and select the desired browser in the External web browsers menu.
- %OPTION% Select Use external web browser, click the New or Search button, add your browser, and then select it in the External web browsers menu.
- %OPTION% Use the Search button to search for an installed web browser.

#### Q16. What view, within the Team component, displays the commits related to a particular project or file?

- %OPTION% Git Staging
- %OPTION% History
- %OPTION% Synchronize
- %OPTION% Git Repositories

#### Q17. What is included in your wqorkspace folder?

- %OPTION% a hidden .metadata folder
- %OPTION% a hidden .metadata folder and projects imported into the workspace only
- %OPTION% only projects imported into the workspace
- %OPTION% a hidden .metadata folder and projects created in the workspace

#### Q18. What can you not do in the Variables view?

- %OPTION% monitor variables that are outside the scope of the current stack frame
- %OPTION% set a breakpoint to track a particular instance
- %OPTION% inspect the values of an object's fields
- %OPTION% edit the value of a variable while the debugger is running your app

#### Q19. What is not a method stub that Eclipse will create for you in the New JUnit Test Case window?

- %OPTION% tearDown()
- %OPTION% setUpClass()
- %OPTION% tearDownAfterClass()
- %OPTION% setUp()

#### Q20. What does the Problems view show?

- %OPTION% all of the answers
- %OPTION% warnings and errors
- %OPTION% code that does not match your formatting settings
- %OPTION% threads containing errors

#### Q21. When switching workspaces, what is preserved?

- %OPTION% all preferences
- %OPTION% none of these answers
- %OPTION% the current perspective
- %OPTION% preferences for a language (e.g., Java)

#### Q22. How can you set files to save automatically when launching an application?

- %OPTION% Click Window (Eclipse) -> Preferences -> Run/Debug -> Launching, and then select Save required dirty editors before launching.
- %OPTION% Click Window (Eclipse) -> Preferences -> Java -> Editor -> Save Actions
- %OPTION% Click File -> Save All.
- %OPTION% Change the project's run configuration.

#### Q23. Which is _not_ a valid way to create a test class?

- %OPTION% In the **Package Explorer**, right-click a class and select **New > JUnit Test Case**.
- %OPTION% none of these answers
- %OPTION% Create a JUnit Test Case class through the **File** menu.
- %OPTION% Create the class manually while in any perspective.

#### Q24. What happens when you double-click a Revision Time in the History view?

- %OPTION% Nothing happens.
- %OPTION% The select file is opened in the Editor in its state at the time of the revision.
- %OPTION% The revision opens in a **Split Editor** window alongside the current local revision of the file.
- %OPTION% A pop-up window showing details about the revision appears.

#### Q25. What is the benefit of using perspectives?

- %OPTION% to switch between preferences within a single workspace
- %OPTION% to easily switch between different layouts of views in the Workbenchfor specific tasks
- %OPTION% to manage the fact that some views work only in certain perspectives
- %OPTION% to debug multiple applications at the same time

[Reference](https://www.eclipse.org/articles/using-perspectives/PerspectiveArticle.html)

#### Q26. When viewing an XML file in Eclipse, how can you view the file in a visual hierarchy (as opposed to code alone)?

- %OPTION% You cannot do this in Eclipse.
- %OPTION% Select the Editor tab for the XML file and then click the Design tab at the bottom of the editor window.
- %OPTION% Double-click the open tab in the Editor.
- %OPTION% In the Package Explorer, right-click the file and select Open With > Desgign Editor.

#### Q27. How can you view all the commits for a single file?

- %OPTION% Open the commit in the Git Staging view.
- %OPTION% Open the commit in the Git Reflog view.
- %OPTION% Double-click a commit in the History view.
- %OPTION% Right-click the file in the Package Explorer and select Team > Show in History.

#### Q28. In the image below, what does the circled button do?

![image Q28](https://github.com/Beziu/linkedin-skill-assessments-quizzes/blob/master/eclipse/images/Eclipse-Q28.jpg)

- %OPTION% It links the Editor and Navigator, causing the Editor to switch to the file selected in the Package Explorer and vice versa.
- %OPTION% It expands Libraries when you are in the Java perspective.
- %OPTION% It minimizes the left view
- %OPTION% It collapses open folders in the Package Explorer view.

#### Q29. Why might you create multiple debug configurations for the same project?

- %OPTION% all of these answers
- %OPTION% to debug using a different JRE
- %OPTION% to customize environment variables
- %OPTION% to customize arguments

#### Q30. You are searching for code using the Search dialog, and no results appear. What is a likely cause?

- %OPTION% all of these answers
- %OPTION% The scope of the search is too narrow.
- %OPTION% The type of search is not appropriate for the language of the code.
- %OPTION% There is a typo in the search parameters.

#### Q31. If you check out a branch in Eclipse and still see the old code, what is one possible problem?

- %OPTION% Your project is not using source control.
- %OPTION% Your internet connection is down.
- %OPTION% Your Git passwordis incorrect.
- %OPTION% You need to refresh your project.

#### Q32. What is required to create a Git commit?

- %OPTION% all of these answers
- %OPTION% a local repository
- %OPTION% staged changes
- %OPTION% a commit message

#### Q33. What can you do in the Eclipse Split Editor?

- %OPTION% view the Design and Source tabs of one XML file at the same time
- %OPTION% drag code from one Editor pane into another
- %OPTION% split the editor either horizontally or vertically
- %OPTION% all of these answers

#### Q34. Why might you run the Project > Clean command?

- %OPTION% to remedy an issue where the source code seemsaccurate, but Git is indicating a merge conflict
- %OPTION% to remedy syntax errors within the source code, causing the project not to build
- %OPTION% to discard any existing build state before building the project, which can remedy issues where the source code seems accurate yet fails to build
- %OPTION% to recompile only the source code files that have changed since the last build, which can shorten the build time for long-running builds

#### Q35. How can you terminate debugging in the Debug view?

- %OPTION% Right-click an item in the stack trace and select Terminate/Disconnect All.
- %OPTION% all of these answers
- %OPTION% Right-click your application and select Terminate.
- %OPTION% Right-click a thread and select Terminate and Remove.

#### Q36. How do you connect to and debug a remote Java application/server?

- %OPTION% Click Run > Debug As > Remote Application.
- %OPTION% You cannot do this in Eclipse.
- %OPTION% Create and run a configuration under Run > Debug Configurations > Remote Java Application.
- %OPTION% Click Run > External Tools.

#### Q37. What is the purpose of adding TODO in a comment?

- %OPTION% It reminds you that you have work to do.
- %OPTION% Comments starting with TODO are listed in the Tasks view.
- %OPTION% It creates automated email reminders of remaining tasks.
- %OPTION% Comments starting with TODO are stored in the Task List view.

en.TITLE: Skill Assessments Quizzes
en.DESC:
Collection of questions and answers on different subjects aimed to help
you test your knowledge before an important job interview!

Data from __data__. UI by __bandinopla__

es.TITLE: Questionarios de evaluación de habilidades
es.DESC:
Colección de preguntas y respuestas sobre diferentes temas orientadas a
ayudarte a testear tu conocimiento antes de una importante entrevista de trabajo! 

Datos de __data__. UI por __bandinopla__
